definition[0]: to have enough money to buy or pay for something
example[0]: I couldn’t afford the rent on my own.
example[1]: How can she afford to eat out every night?
example[2]: We can’t afford to go on vacation this year.
definition[1]: to have enough time to do something
example[3]: Dad can’t afford any more time off work.
definition[2]: if you cannot afford to do something, you must not do it because it could cause serious problems for you
example[4]: We can’t afford to wait any longer or we’ll miss the plane.
